intro: Zanthoxylum mauiense var. maunahuiense, commonly known as Maui chili or Maunahui chili, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces bright red, fiery fruits that are highly sought after for their unique flavor and culinary use. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this distinctive botanical treasure.
